ref: 14189 hválati ʻ goes crookedly, goes wrong, stumbles, falls ʼ ŚBr. [hvárati tr. ʻ twists ʼ Dhātup., úpa hváratē ʻ goes crookedly towards ʼ RV., aor. hvārṣīt VS. -- √hval]
K. halun ʻ to be or become crooked, be warped ʼ;
Or. bhaḷibā ʻ to be mistaken, be bewildered, become soft or liquid, develop signs of collapse (of a woman newly delivered) ʼ.
